728.60 metres to [[Acadie (Montreal Metro)|Acadie]] |addresses= 1400, Van Horne Avenue |intersections= Van Horne Avenue / Wiseman Avenue [http://www.stm.info/English/metro/Outremont.pdf Outremont Station, Neighbourhood Map] |}} '''Outremont''' is a station on the [[Line 5 Blue (Montreal Metro)|Blue Line]] of the [[Montreal Metro]] [[Rapid transit|rapid transit system]], operated by the [[SociÃ©tÃ© de transport de MontrÃ©al]] (STM) . It is located in the [[Outremont (borough)|Outremont borough]] of [[Montreal]], [[Quebec]], [[Canada]] [http://www.stm.info/English/metro/a-m58.htm Outremont Metro Station]. == Overview == It is a normal [[side platform]] station with a mined trainroom and open-cut volume at one end, containing the ticket hall and topped by the one large entrance and a glazed skylight. Classic materials and a mural of glazed ceramics by [[Gilbert Poissant]] evoke the architecture of the surrounding neighbourhood, as does a City of Outremont lamp post at the foot of the stairs to one platform. ==Origin of name== The station takes its name from the borough (formerly city) of [[Outremont (borough)|Outremont]], in which it is located. Originally named CÃ´te-Sainte-Catherine, the town took its name in 1875 from a mansion, still extant, built in 1833 by Louis-TancrÃ¨de Bouthillier and named "Outre-Mont" ("beyond the mountain" from the main settlement of Montreal). ==Connecting bus routes== {{Main|SociÃ©tÃ© de transport de MontrÃ©al}} {{Main|List of Montreal Bus Routes}}
